organic_results.title: On the uses, misuses and abuses of Jencks' Inequality
organic_results.snippet: THIS BOOK Is a paradigm-breaker. Educationists are confounded by its reporting that school quality has little effect on student performanceschools produce good students because they select good students. Sociologists are shaken by the report that the family in the USA has a small effect on the incomes of children and that there is little inheritance of economic status although incomes vary widely. A highly inegalitarian society operates somewhat randomly. Economists are bewildered to discover that educational and occupational levels are little …
